column2: WISCONSIN DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Wisconsin
column6: WI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: wait for the next green light.
column10: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.

column2: 2. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Pentagon

column2: 3. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Pedestrian crossing
column6: Proceed with caution

column2: 4. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 5. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: If it's been raining several hours.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: When it has just begun to rain.

column2: 6. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: white triangles.
column6: blue rectangles.

column2: 7. A broken yellow line to the right of a solid yellow center line means:
column4: you may pass other vehicles if no oncoming traffic is present.
column6: passing is prohibited.
column8: you are only allowed to make left turns in this area.

column2: 8. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Only right turns are allowed.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Wrong Way
column6: Left turns are permitted
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 10. When preparing to drive, you should:
column4: adjust your seat and mirrors.
column6: shift the transmission to neutral.

column2: 11. Before turning, you should:
column4: give the proper turn signal.
column6: change lanes.
column10: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.

column2: 12. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.
column6: Sudden stops.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Do not block intersection
column10: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 14. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

column2: 15. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: slow down.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Road narrows ahead
column6: Stop if necessary

column2: 18. The Implied Consent Law means that:
column4: drivers under 21 cannot drive after drinking any alcohol.
column6: drivers must drink more than one drink to be tested for the amount of alcohol in their blood.
column8: penalties become more severe after a 2nd OWI.
column10: drivers agree to be tested for the amount of alcohol in their blood, if they are arrested for drunk or impaired driving.

column2: 19. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their left.
column6: move to the lane on their right.

column2: 20. Green and white signs:
column4: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column6: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column8: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 21. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column4: steady red
column6: steady green

column2: 22. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column6: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 23. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: listen to loud music while driving.
column6: have a few drinks before driving.
column8: drive fast to let off steam.
column10: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: Low clearance

column2: 25. A curb painted red means:
column4: Parking is for disabled persons with a special placard or plate.
column6: Reserved for passengers pick up or drop off

column2: 26. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.

column2: 27. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer right
column6: stay in the center of your lane
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 28. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column6: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.
column10: You are driving in the wrong direction. Make a U-turn as soon as possible.

column2: 29. Drivers already in a roundabout:
column4: shouldn't have to stop.
column6: should stop and give the right-of-way to drivers who are not in the roundabout.
column8: should give the right-of-way to the vehicles behind them.

column2: 30. If the roadway is wet, you should:
column4: maintain the same speed.
column6: reduce your speed.

column2: 31. This warning sign:
column4: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column6: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column8: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 32. A flashing red light means:
column4: Slow down before entering.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 33. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Maintenance warning.
column6: Railroad crossing.

column2: 34. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column4: expect the unexpected.
column6: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn on red light permitted
column6: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 36. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column8: To keep a smooth traffic flow.

column2: 37. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are not wearing safety belts.
column6: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column8: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.

column2: 38. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 39. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column6: No, never.
column10: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 40. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column6: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column8: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column10: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.

column2: 41. This road sign means:
column4: One-way street ahead
column6: No Passing Zone

column2: 42. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to suddenly run into the street.
column6: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column8: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column10: to know when it is safe to cross.

column2: 43. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column6: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 44. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 45. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: they must stop at the next intersection.
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 46. This road sign means:
column4: You may proceed only if the way is clear
column6: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way

column2: 47. The yield sign means:
column4: Stop.
column6: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 48. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: what is not allowed.
column6: the law.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 49. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column6: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column8: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.

column2: 50. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: reaction speed
column6: maximum speed
